bill.title: Resisting Arrest in the First Degree
bill.description: Creates the offense of resisting arrest in the first degree as a class C felony if the person intentionally prevents a law enforcement officer acting under color of the law enforcement officer's official authority from effecting an arrest by removing or attempting to remove a firearm from the person of a law enforcement officer. Amends the existing resisting arrest offense to resisting arrest in the second degree. Effective 07/01/50. (SD1)

referrals.name: Public Safety, Intergovernmental and Military Affairs

history.action: Pending Introduction.
Introduced.
Passed First Reading.
Referred to PSM, JDL.
The committee(s) on PSM has scheduled a public hearing on 01-28-14 3:00PM in conference room 224.

The committee(s) on PSM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in PSM were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Espero, Baker, Green; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Galuteria, Slom.
Reported from PSM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2064) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading and referral to JDL.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to JDL.
The committee(s) on JDL has scheduled a public hearing on 02-12-14 10:00AM in conference room 016.

The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDL were as follows: 6 Aye(s): Senator(s) Hee, Shimabukuro, Galuteria, Ihara; Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Solomon, Slom ; 0 No(es): none; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Gabbard.
Reported from JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 2515) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 1).
48 Hrs. Notice 03-04-14.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 1). Ayes, 25; Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Solomon, Slom . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
Received from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 83) in amended form (SD 1).
Pass First Reading
Referred to PBS, JUD, referral sheet 28
Bill scheduled to be heard by PBS on Thursday, 03-13-14 10:00AM in House conference room 309.

The committees on PBS recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 7 Ayes: Representative(s) Aquino, Ing, Ichiyama, Nakashima, Takayama, Yamane, Yamashita; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 3 Excused: Representative(s) Har, Takumi, McDermott.
Reported from PBS (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1037-14), recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to JUD.
Passed Second Reading and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Takai, Thielen excused (2).
